newsitem.title: USA: Arkansas wheat harvest nears completion.
newsitem.headline: Arkansas wheat harvest nears completion.

text.p: The Arkansas soft red winter wheat harvest neared completion during the week ended Sunday, acccording to the state's weekly Agricultural Statistics Service update.
Wheat was harvested on 92 percent of the acreage, compared with 71 percent the previous week, 97 percent a year ago and the average of 97 percent.

Soybeans were 87 percent emerged, down slightly from 89 percent for a year ago and the five-year average of 88 percent. Five percent of the crop had bloomed, versus 13 percent a year ago and the five-year average of 11 percent.
Soybeans were rated 14 percent excellent, 49 percent good, 30 fair, and seven poor.
Rice condition was rated 20 percent excellent, 49 percent good, 30 percent fair and seven percent poor.
Cotton boll setting was zero, compared with 34 percent a year ago and the average of 16 percent. Cotton squaring was 86 percent, compared with 99 percent a year ago and 92 percent on average.
Cotton condition was rated two percent excellent, 38 percent good, 48 percent fair and 12 percent poor.
Soil moisture supplies were one percent very short, 20 percent short, 75 percent adequate and four percent surplus.
